content.label: I have to say that I really like this game. I love the challenge that it presents, the simple rules it employs, and the lack of a timer or time component. Game time wise, each new game can take a couple of minutes to play or can be stretched out for 10+ minutes depending on how strategic you want to get. It's the perfect game for a bus ride or coffee break.

This game is fun. It's easy to play. I find the sounds quite enjoyable also.

That's where the positive ends. Vegas mode is broken. Developer did not think this through. I would say the success rate to clear the board is maybe 1 in 20 games. If you get close to clearing it, you can actually get some money back in your bank, but not enough to cover your ante, so you will never unlock the true grit mode. 

Also has accelerating ads. By that I mean they come more frequently as time goes on. First few days an ad every few games. Now it's an ad every game. Not worth it to me to pay for ad removal when the game is fundamentally flawed. 

Good attempt but could be better.

title.label: Fun but needs a silence option

content.label: Pretty fun game but I wish I could silence it, not that it makes much noise but I want to be able to listen to music without other sounds interfering.
I love this game! Great design, fun mix of poker and solitaire, easy to learn but challenging, perfect for when you have a few minutes of free time.

Played the free version (and regrettably bought the paid version) and it was fun. Difficult game, which I like, but the design has flaws. The scoring system doesn't reward you enough.  The requirement to span more than one row causes too many failed games. Once you get a decent high score, it's next to near impossible to beat it because it's basically a maximum. The vegas mode is completely broken. You start with $500 and a minimum of a $50 ante. Your payout is based on a multiplier you increase by clearing the top two rows of cards. Even if you successfully clear the entire board and get the bonus multiplier you don't make your ante back meaning you always lose money from the bank regardless. Vegas mode should really be called "completely broken and not thought out mode designed so you will never unlock true grit mode even though you paid $2.99 to unlock mode". Disappointed as I think the game has great potential outside of the frustrating flaws which could be easily fixed.
Very addictive. My favorite is Vegas mode. The design is perfect, clean and chic. The doubles and fifteens mode seem pointless though ... not enough difference in gameplay to make them interesting.

Absolutely great and addictive game. It is a one more go and then wow an hour has passed and I really need to put it down kind of game. All the modes are fun and challenging. Another great buy from a great developer.

This is my favorite game; my 'go-to game. It's unique, a different breed of solitaire that I've never seen before. It's deceptively simple to play, but quite a challenge to win (by clearing the board, beating your highest score, or if you want, competing against the leaderboards and other challenges). It offers tons of backgrounds, card backs, ways to play, and fun 'awards' with a sense of humor - all in a seamless, simple and uncluttered format. Brilliantly done!! 

There are different options of play, like "Vegas Style", "Single Deck", "Double Deck" and a couple more. I've been playing Single Deck all along and still not bored! I look forward to trying the others.

UPDATE: Aug 2016
Wanted to review again, after the latest update. Everything I said in original review still stands, and then some! I still play this game all the time - still my go-to game after all these months! I Never get bored of it. Since my last review I tried out the 15-mode game, and I am addicted! I also tried Vegas style, and definitely have a lot of room to grow on that one :-o. I love the challenge of it. I am also very glad the game lets me reset my bank back to where it started. (I wasn't doing so bad, but my husband tried and he really put me in debt!). I can't say enough about Sage Solitaire! Thank you, zac (i think that's the right name for who created this game)... you are a genius!!

Very addictive and challenging. My only issue is that in Vegas mode, I bet 200 dollars, clear the board, and only win 75 bucks. So I had to spend 200 to earn 75, it doesn't make sense. It's unrealistic to earn the $800 necessary to unlock the next mode. They force you to pay for it.
Very enjoyable varietal solitaire it can take some thinking and choices. It also has enough of a challenge it makes it interesting to play.
I had to delete this app because I knew I'd fail my finals if it was there.

I love the concept of combining poker and solitaire. It's fun to play, but too frustrating. Not being able to just play cards in 1 row, when there are only 3 rows to begin with, is too limiting. Add the fact that the bottom row has few cards, your often working with only 2 rows. Ending up with 1 row means you lost the game. And why no 2 pairs? A few tweaks and this would be a great game.
This game is fun for a while. It gets frustrating because it is almost impossible to win, even if you do everything correctly. I like the idea of this game, but I don't like the execution.
Not sure why this game is getting such good reviews. I found it incredibly boring, the fact that you have to use cards from two rows makes it so that you rarely ever complete a game.
I like the Vegas version, but just keep going further into the hole. What's with the 0.X multiplier? Might be tempted to pay for upgrade if I knew it also removed the ridiculous de-multiplier.
The game is a lot of fun, but as another review said the randomizer is broken. If you trash a card you almost always get another card with the same value.

title.label: Sage Solitaire Poker is MUCH BETTER

content.label: I'd played Sage Solitaire off and on for a couple of months but could never get into it. There were stupid things I didn't like about it (Ex: can't make two pair, can't use only cards in the same row, ...). Fortunately I stumbled across Sage Solitaire Poker (similar name, different app) and am having a blast! If the things I mentioned or others annoy you, give Sage Solitaire Poker a try.

This would be a great game except it's nearly impossible. You want you to clear your table of cards but is limited to only playing cards of different rows and only two trashes. I keep playing and playing, I'm not doing anything wrong because I started using the hints and I'm still losing. Unless your extremely lucky, you will not win. It's not a game of skill, it's a game of luck. A game of frustrating luck.

You win some, but lose A LOT. A lot of the losing seems to do with luck. Great design, nice and clean, easy to learn and play, but winning is too few, far, and between. Can't buy it if winning is that tedious. Single deck is cool (I can deal with the losing here), but Vegas is just irritating. It's all but impossible to break even, let alone actually come out ahead.
I love this game--reminds me of my love for poker. This game has pleasing color scheme and sound. It's easy to navigate. Plus the challenge is fun.
This captures the part of Solitaire in Windows that kept me playing for hours. Seriously, very well done.
Can I please have my true grit mode back?? Pretty please??

The sweet spot for a game is when you win just enough to make you think you can clean up on the next game. It's how slot machines take your money. This game doesn't have that. The game play is great and engaging, but except for a few savants out there, the rest of us really never stand a chance. And "Vegas Mode"? Forget it! This game is good for a few minutes at a time, but knowing you just can't ever beat it means it's easy to quit and move on.

title.label: It's just okay, it has potential.

content.label: It's not a phenomenal game (at least the free version isn't, I haven't seen anything from the free version to make me willing to pay for more). I gave 2 stars because overall the game just does not capture my attention. It's difficult to win, when trashing cards it gives you a card of the same value plus  the rule of having to have cards in separate rows  to create a hand makes it impossible to actually win a hand; there is nothing to suggest that if I pay that these 2 things can be changed or that they will go away. Otherwise it seems like it might be fun. It has a lot of potential, I just can't see me playing it often since currently I have no chance of winning at it.  I'll keep it for when I want something different.
This is a good game. You'll never make money in Vegas mode, so that mode is pointless. This game can be improved.
Needs landscape mode

title.label: Not giving me all my points

content.label: We love this game, but are frustrated that with some hands, we don't get the points. What's up with that? Would love to get it fixed. It's a great game.
Gravy, add an auto reset bank option to Vegas mode when below $500?
This game is a clone of another popular card game. A shameless rip off down to the score values behind each stack of cards.

I do enjoy this game, it's one of my favorite time wasting and non-stressful games. There is an identical game on the Google play store that I like slightly better due to some of the game mechanics. Like being able to play cards from the same row, being able to have two pairs, and things like that. I also would prefer having a landscape option, but that's not a major complaint for me. I sincerely hope these things will be considered, but we shall see. Over all it's a pretty nice game.

The developer would like to write off the continuous duplication of a like card under another as frequency illusion.  That's just a lazy way of denying that your algorithm for placing cards is flawed.  I wrote down the frequency - it's real, not an illusion.  I suggest the developer instead Google proper randomization routines.  The deck is not rigged, as like the developer said, why would he do that.  But he should at least admit his app is flawed in its execution.
Love love love love this game, it is fun and a great stress reliever. Thank you Zach

How about including the jokers as wild cards? 
What about multiplying the hand score by the number of starred cards?

This game is so addictive but I need ways to increase my score.

title.label: Good and addictive...wish it were better.

content.label: Very fun and addictive game. It's difficult to earn money though if you don't clear the board every time. Another issue is often when you trash a card, the same numbered card of a different suit will be beneath it. This happens far too often.

Vegas mode was a great addition to this game but obviously these game designers aren't gamblers. It is nearly impossible to ever win any money in Vegas mode...the winnings versus the ante needed to play is dumb. Bet $200 to maybe win 50 bucks. Good game concept they just need to adjust the points system on the backend. Even in regular mode, you get rewarded with 10 points for a killer hand. High scores look like 75 points or something lame like that. Hard to get excited over 75 points unless your playing football.

title.label: Could have been a 5 Star game BUT...

content.label: ...There is no landscape display setting and that's a deal breaker for a solitaire variant.  Why, why, why not add that option (most universal card game apps have it so iPad users like me can be happy customers)?!?

At first I was fumbling through the game not really getting the point. Then I decided to actually READ the instructions. Then I began to increase my score and make more strategic moves. This lead to clearing the board. Fifteen is awesome too because it combines arithmetic. Folks out there complaining that there are algorithmic flaws with the software design are giving up. As Jerry Garcia said, "High low-jack and the winner take the hand."

I have become obsessed with this game. I got it last night and have already played over 100 games as I had passed the 100 game achievement awhile ago. I've hardly eaten or slept. I started making charts to track which cards are still in play and honestly I can't stop playing. Vegas mode is extremely hard and it has taken me a lot of my time just to get to $600. Anyways I'm obsessed and no longer will have any sort of social life, thank you (:
Nice time killer. Thanks to the Dev for the frequency illusion reference.
I enjoy the game just wish it offered horizontal view option since I play it on my iPad

I've been playing this a lot lately. Very, very fun casual game! But it's hampered by a scoring mechanism that over-favors clearing the board. In Vegas mode, if you don't clear the board you simply cannot score high enough to recoup your ante. Maybe I'm missing a subtlety that allows strategies other than clearing to score, but I've tried and tried to figure it out. Fix the scoring, and this is definitely a 5 star game.

I love this game. It's interesting and calming. For some reason, if I ever feel anxious or something, I play this game and it always calms me down. And people. Please. The game is NOT rigged. Stop being ridiculous. There is zero reason to rig this; it would just be stupid. Thank you, thank you developer for not having 'in-game purchases' where you do everything you can to take all our money. I truly appreciate it. And, in the new update notes . . very funny stuff. Great job; great game. Keep it up!
Great game

Latest update:
Not much for me since I'm terrible at Vegas mode. Haha. I unlocked the full mode and don't regret it. Great game!!

2nd update:
Free stuff!! Nice! Been on the fence for awhile. Gonna buy it now. Thanks!

First Update:
Still haven't bought the full version yet, but added another star for the great update. This app dev cares about his app and his customers.

Original review:

Thanks for the free version of the game. Great design and fun, although short (which I assume is what the double deck is for).

While I understand the double deck, what the heck is fifteens mode? I don't see a description or preview anywhere. Also could we get a preview of the other unlocks? Wanna make sure I know what I'm buying. Thanks!

Very addictive game, but the randomizer in the game is broken. Odds are greater than 50% that when you clear or trash a card, you'll get another card of the same value underneath. Trash a 4, and you'll get another 4. Kindof ruins the experience.

Note: I'm not accusing the developerof rigging the deck; rather, of merely failing to recognize a bug in the randomizer implementation.

title.label: Basically the best solitaire game on the App Store

content.label: Buy it.  For real, buy it now.

What an awesome game!  I'm loving the new modes. Perfect game for a quick fix or long play sessions.  The dev is very active with updates.   All we need are more manly cards and backgrounds.   Maybe a vectrex mode, etc.

title.label: Only problem: too addictive, and that's a good thing. The

content.label: I absolutely love this game!!! Can't get enough! Keep up the good work!
Fun challenges!  Fast to play.  Highly recommended!!

I find most solitaire games fun for a couple of hours. Not only am I way past that mark, I keep coming back to this game and changing up my strategies. The different game modes really push me to try different things, too. As a bonus, since I play the Doomtown ECG, it's had the side effect of helping me recognize hands.
